name: librarian
long_description:
librarian Cookbook ================== TODO: Enter the cookbook description here. e.g. This cookbook makes your favorite breakfast sandwhich. Requirements ------------ TODO: List your cookbook requirements. Be sure to include any requirements this cookbook has on platforms, libraries, other cookbooks, packages, operating systems, etc. e.g. #### packages - `toaster` - librarian needs toaster to brown your bagel. Attributes ---------- TODO: List you cookbook attributes here. e.g. #### librarian::default
Key Type Description Default
['librarian']['bacon'] Boolean whether to include bacon true
Usage ----- #### librarian::default TODO: Write usage instructions for each cookbook. e.g. Just include `librarian` in your node's `run_list`: ```json { "name":"my_node", "run_list": [ "recipe[librarian]" ] } ``` Contributing ------------ TODO: (optional) If this is a public cookbook, detail the process for contributing. If this is a private cookbook, remove this section. e.g. 1. Fork the repository on Github 2. Create a named feature branch (like `add_component_x`) 3. Write you change 4. Write tests for your change (if applicable) 5. Run the tests, ensuring they all pass 6. Submit a Pull Request using Github License and Authors ------------------- Authors: TODO: List authors

librarian/chef/cookbook_path.description: The folder to download/manage cookbooks with librarian-chef.

librarian/chef/cheffile.description: The Cheffile to use to download/manage cookbooks with librarian-chef (this can be a remote URL to a Cheffile).

librarian/install_git.description: Whether to install the git client or not.

chef/parent.description: The Chef platform this cookbook is used in.

recipes.librarian::default: Installs/configures librarian including cookbooks download as a default.
recipes.librarian::download_cookbooks: Downloads cookbooks from the provided Cheffile.
